intro: Pedicularis gracilituba, commonly known as the slender tube lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found at high elevations. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
